physicalDescription.extent: Material: PaperDimensions: 162 x 120 mm leaf [113 x 70 mm written]Foliation: Arabic pagination in blue crayon; British Museum foliation in pencilRuling: None visible; 15 lines per page; vertical spacing 13 lines per 10 cmQuires: Seven quires of ten leaves; quire marks in blue crayon in upper left-hand corners of ff. 11r, 21r, 31r, 41r, 51r and 61rScript: NaskhInk: Black ink, with rubricationsBinding: British Museum binding with envelope flapCondition: Excellent condition, with light foxingMarginalia: some section headings marked باب in blue crayon, and very few marginal corrections and notes (e.g. ff. 57r, 68v and 69v)

mods.abstract: Three treatises on the prediction of future events based on astronomical, meteorological and other natural phenomena. The contents of the volume are:Fihrist Arisṭā[ ṭā] līs(ff 1v-37r);Treatise on meteorological divination attributed to the prophet Daniel (ff 37r-64r);Ramādī, Ibn Murād, Tarṣīd shaḥr al-Muḥarram al-mubārrak(ff 64v-69v).The manuscript was copied on 19 Ṣafar 1295 (22 February 1878; see colophon of Item Three, f. 69v).
